qas.question: What type of government does New York City have?
In what year did New York City adopt the mayor-council form of government?

context: New York City has been a metropolitan municipality with a <a0_0>mayor-council<a0_0/> form of government since its consolidation in <a1_0>1898<a1_0/>. The government of New York is more centralized than that of most other U.S. cities. In New York City, the city government is responsible for public education, correctional institutions, public safety, recreational facilities, sanitation, water supply, and welfare services.
